column4: running update-grub will not remove kernels from the list, you have to uninstall them to do that.
wow you just made me realize I have a bunch of old kernels still installed on my system XD
FYI from terminal "dpkg -l | grep linux-image" lists them
thanks i always thought that the package system automatically removed the old one when you update, but that would be dangerous because new images don't always work. The more you know haha
